summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear and testify in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell on November 29, 2021. The subpoena requires personal appearance at 40 Foley Square and warns of contempt penalties for failure to comply.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) for which the subpoena is issued to compel testimony.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena on July 13, 2021.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Testimony
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear in court to testify and give evidence in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued on July 13, 2021, compelling an unnamed individual to testify in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The subpoena demands personal appearance at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m.
Failure to comply is stated to constitute contempt of court, subjecting the recipient to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena is signed by Audrey Strauss, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case as of late 2021.
